benchmark_details.name: CODE-VISION
benchmark_details.overview: CODE-VISION is a benchmark designed to evaluate the logical understanding and code generation capabilities of Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) by challenging them to generate correct programs based on given flowcharts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate multimodal large language models' logical understanding and code generation capabilities.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset size of CODE-VISION is relatively limited, especially in the Hard category of the Algorithm and MATH subsets.

data.annotation: Manually curated from various programming sources.

methodology.calculation: Pass@1 represents the probability that at least one correct solution appears among the top k generated solutions for each problem.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Pass@1 implies better model performance in generating correct code from flowcharts.
methodology.baseline_results: Proprietary models like GPT-4o achieved a top score of 79.3% on hard problems.
methodology.validation: No explicit detailed validation procedures mentioned.
